Can you try `mvn clean install` from root first, and then `mvn clean verify` in the amqp module ?

From my side the test looks good. We could think about adding it to `WindowTest`, instead of creating a new file, however.

Regarding the Spark runner, this needs either an exclusion or a fix.
run java postcommit

R: @iemejia @mairbek @jkff 

This test has been broken for a while now. There seem to be a couple of causes.

@kennknowles let me give you some background ;) Beam SDK core has a dependency to commons-lang, this dependency is used by the SDK itself and also by some IOs (thanks to transitive deps). Recently we upgraded to latest commons-lang version. This new version moved some packages to a new artifact commons-text. If commons-text is not directly used by the SDK, it's used by some IOs (like SpannerIO WriteIT for instance). That's why I included commons-text (as commons-lang) in the shaded jar.
run java postcommit
Also addressed in #3437
R: @jbonofre

I tried to build the PR locally on my machine and `SpannerIO` tests failed with:

```
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: A project ID is required for this service but could not be determined from the builder or the environment.  Please set a project ID using the builder.
        at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:122)
        at com.google.cloud.ServiceOptions.<init>(ServiceOptions.java:238)
        at com.google.cloud.spanner.SpannerOptions.<init>(SpannerOptions.java:81)
        at com.google.cloud.spanner.SpannerOptions.<init>(SpannerOptions.java:43)
        at com.google.cloud.spanner.SpannerOptions$Builder.build(SpannerOptions.java:180)
        at org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.spanner.SpannerConfig.buildSpannerOptions(SpannerConfig.java:60)
        at org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.spanner.AbstractSpannerFn.setup(AbstractSpannerFn.java:39)

```

any idea ?
R: @jbonofre

For ref, after applying this patch I can build the full project by skipping some things with maven 3.5 and JDK 9+175.
```
mvn -Dcompiler.error.flag="" -Denforcer.skip=true clean compile test-compile
```
The other issues with the enforcer plugin and autovalue need to addressed on upstream I think first.

@jbonofre I think we might need this and also some piece of your fix.
Looks like this didn't fix it.

The error you got locally is because the IT doesn't set up the auth pipeline options so you'll need to set them up on the command line or in your IDE.

For Jenkins it is done in the Groovy script.
I have confirmed that this IT fails immediately in the direct runner because the table name is invalid. So we do need this PR.

The IOs should directly declare a dependency on it if they use it. We need to (re-) enable dependency analysis on those IOs since that should cause a failure. I think this is https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-2272
Sorry, my bad - I forgot to run postcommit / run the IT manually when merging.

I created #3471 about my specific issue.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/12188061/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/12188061)

Coverage remained the same at 70.857% when pulling **47fa2b7f099f3177787ec4280502effaa72ff600 on jbonofre:SPANNERIO_READ_TEST_FIX** into **997bf402511d2b2468385fcfd2b3aa4dba52eac5 on apache:master**.

For the record, this is the exception I have on my machine on the read test:

```
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: A project ID is required for this service but could not be determined from the builder or the environment.  Please set a project ID using the builder.
        at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:122)
        at com.google.cloud.ServiceOptions.<init>(ServiceOptions.java:238)
        at com.google.cloud.spanner.SpannerOptions.<init>(SpannerOptions.java:81)
        at com.google.cloud.spanner.SpannerOptions.<init>(SpannerOptions.java:43)
        at com.google.cloud.spanner.SpannerOptions$Builder.build(SpannerOptions.java:180)
        at org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.spanner.SpannerConfig.buildSpannerOptions(SpannerConfig.java:60)
        at org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.spanner.AbstractSpannerFn.setup(AbstractSpannerFn.java:39)
```
So, the postcommit is busted anyhow and I don't think we got meaningful negative signal from it. There is a slightly novel failure in the BigTable e2e test that bears a re-run.
LGTM unless the re-run shows something more than the known breakage.
Thanks @aljoscha. I agree, it is better to put this test with the other window related tests. I'll also add a new category interface to skip this test in runners that don't support it

Yes, I was trying to find resources about how dependency scopes relate to ITs, but I could not find anything useful. What I read implied that it would include `<scope>test</scope>`. We need to solve this without changing the SDK, because this sort of module is not generally going to be part of our project, but just some externally developed IO.
But, incidentally, the restriction to letters is very real. The random string generator definitely produces invalid names. So I will drop the dependency stuff and just merge the name fixes.

This seems like a lot of hassle just to generate an alphanumeric string.
Can we just do it manually without common-text, by standard Java library?

On Thu, Jun 29, 2017, 4:37 AM Jean-Baptiste Onofr <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> *@jbonofre* requested changes on this pull request.
>
> Clearly, commons-text is not in the classloader used for the IT:
>
> Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.commons.text.RandomStringGenerator$Builder
>
> It seems that just adding the dependency is not enough (it's already the
> case before the PR).
>
> I will take a new look as it seems that even adding commons-text in the
> shaded jar is not enough though.
>
> 
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3459#pullrequestreview-47096987>, or mute
> the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAU-qp_MhX4uXXJQqy_Qa5mFf8mIfmCjks5sI4xpgaJpZM4OIB1l>
> .
>
Run Flink ValidatesRunner

I rebased on top of master and also made sure that the two-phase pipeline translation call is made in the right place, it's now called in `FlinkRunner` directly. @peihe this ports over your earlier change to another place, could you maybe check if I didn't break your changes?
Run Flink ValidatesRunner
